title: Furo Girl!
text:
is a Japanese <a href="manga">manga</a> series written and illustrated by Yukio Katayama. The manga was serialized in the <a href="Shogakukan">Shogakukan</a> publication "<a href="Big%20Comic%20Spirits">Big Comic Spirits</a>" from 2015 to 2016. The series depicts the lifestyle of a 25-year-old office worker and <a href="bathing">bath</a> lover Sayoko Oyumino.
It was adapted into a <a href="Japanese%20television%20drama">live-action drama</a> which was broadcast on <a href="TV%20Tokyo">TV Tokyo</a> in 2020 starring <a href="Hinako%20Sakurai">Hinako Sakurai</a>.
Media.
Manga.
"Furo Girl!", written and illustrated by Yukio Katayama, was serialized in <a href="Shogakukan">Shogakukan</a>'s <a href="Seinen%20manga">"seinen" manga</a> magazine "<a href="Big%20Comic%20Spirits">Big Comic Spirits</a>" from August 10, 2015, to November 21, 2016. Its chapters were collected in three "<a href="tank%C5%8Dbon">tankōbon</a>" volumes, released from February 29, 2016, to February 28, 2017.
Chapters not released in "tankōbon".
These two chapters were serialized in the "<a href="Big%20Comic%20Spirits">Big Comic Spirits</a>" as chapters 3 and 7, but were omitted from the "<a href="tank%C5%8Dbon">tankōbon</a>" releases changing the chapter numbers for the rest of the chapters in them.
Live-action TV series.
A live-action TV series is set to premiere on July 15, 2020 starring <a href="Hinako%20Sakurai">Hinako Sakurai</a>.
